problem: Customer says the internet stopped working after cleaning the desk; router power light is off.
solution: Found the power adapter was loose. Plugged the adapter firmly into the wall socket; service restored.

problem: User forgot their Wi-Fi password and cannot connect new devices.
solution: Guided the user to the router admin page (192.168.1.1) and reset the WPA2 Pre-Shared Key.

problem: Internet is slow when using Wi-Fi in the backyard far from the router.
solution: Explained Wi-Fi range limitations. Recommended moving the router to a central location in the house.

problem: The router is frozen and the lights are not blinking.
solution: Performed a power cycle by unplugging the router for 30 seconds. All services resumed after reboot.

problem: Customer wants to know when their next bill is due.
solution: Checked the billing system and informed the customer that the due date is the 5th of every month.

problem: The LAN cable is plugged in but the computer says 'Cable Disconnected'.
solution: The Ethernet cable was damaged. Replaced the cable with a new one; connection established.

problem: Customer wants to change the name of their Wi-Fi (SSID).
solution: Accessed the wireless settings and updated the SSID to the customer's preferred name.

problem: Customer reports slow speeds while downloading 5 large files at once.
solution: Explained bandwidth sharing. Advised pausing some downloads to improve speed on the primary task.

problem: User is getting an 'Invalid Login' error on the self-service portal.
solution: Sent a password reset link to the customer's registered email address.

problem: Internet went out during a heavy rainstorm.
solution: Found that the local power trip turned off the ONT. Flipped the circuit breaker and service returned.

problem: The Wi-Fi light on the router is off.
solution: The physical Wi-Fi button on the side of the router was pressed by mistake. Pressed it again to enable Wi-Fi.

problem: Customer wants to upgrade their current plan to the next higher speed.
solution: Processed the plan change request in the CRM and applied the new speed profile immediately.

problem: Red light on the router labeled 'Internet'.
solution: The service was suspended due to non-payment. Reactivated service after the customer cleared the dues.

problem: Websites are taking a long time to load on a single laptop.
solution: Cleared the browser cache and cookies. Performance returned to normal.

problem: The power cord for the router is frayed and showing wires.
solution: Swapped the damaged power cord with a new manufacturer-approved adapter for safety.

problem: New tenant needs the Wi-Fi credentials for the shared office space.
solution: Provided the authorized SSID and WPA2 password to the new user.

problem: User reset the router using a pin and now has no internet.
solution: The factory reset erased the PPPoE settings. Re-configured the username and password on the router.

problem: Speed is slow on an old laptop but fast on a new phone.
solution: Old laptop only supports 2.4GHz Wi-Fi. Recommended using a USB Wi-Fi adapter for 5GHz support.

problem: The internet light is green but no websites are opening.
solution: Restarted the user's computer to refresh the network stack. Internet started working.

problem: Customer wants to set up a password for their Wi-Fi for the first time.
solution: Enabled WPA2 security in the wireless settings and helped the user set a strong password.

problem: The fiber cable at home was chewed by a pet.
solution: Replaced the damaged fiber patch cable between the wall socket and the ONT.

problem: Customer is confused about a 'Pro-rata' charge on their first bill.
solution: Explained that the first bill includes the partial month from the activation date plus the next full month.

problem: Online video is buffering frequently.
solution: Changed the video quality from 4K to 1080p to match the available bandwidth of the current plan.

problem: The provider's mobile app keeps crashing when clicking 'Pay Bill'.
solution: Advised the customer to update the app from the Play Store. Update resolved the crash.

problem: All lights on the ONT are off despite being plugged in.
solution: The power outlet was faulty. Plugged the ONT into a different wall socket and it powered on.

problem: Customer wants to turn off Wi-Fi at night automatically.
solution: Configured the 'Wi-Fi Schedule' feature in the router settings to turn off radios from 12 AM to 6 AM.

problem: Speeds are low because the router is hidden inside a metal cabinet.
solution: Moved the router out of the metal cabinet to reduce signal shielding. Speeds improved immediately.

problem: User is getting a 'Remote Server Not Responding' error on their router.
solution: Verified the PPPoE password was entered incorrectly. Updated the password and connection was established.

problem: One of the LAN ports on the back of the router is physically broken.
solution: Advised the user to use one of the other three functional LAN ports.

problem: The whole neighborhood has no internet light on their routers.
solution: Identified a power failure at the local distribution node. Service resumed once power was restored.

problem: I forgot my email password.
solution: Please go to the company login page, click on 'Forgot Password', and follow the steps to reset your email password.

problem: My account is locked due to multiple failed login attempts.
solution: Wait 15 minutes for auto-unlock or contact IT to manually reset your account.

problem: How can I change my password proactively?
solution: Log in to the company portal, go to 'Account Settings', and click on 'Change Password'.

problem: Unable to connect to VPN.
solution: Ensure VPN client is up to date. Restart your PC, launch the VPN app, and reconnect.

problem: Internet is slow.
solution: Disconnect and reconnect to Wi-Fi. If the issue persists, contact the local IT network admin.

problem: VPN keeps disconnecting frequently.
solution: Check if you're on a stable network. If on mobile hotspot, switch to wired or Wi-Fi.

problem: Laptop keyboard is not working.
solution: Try restarting the laptop. If the issue persists, plug in an external keyboard and raise a hardware replacement ticket.

problem: Monitor is not displaying anything.
solution: Check power cable and HDMI/DisplayPort connection. Try another monitor if possible.

problem: Mouse is unresponsive.
solution: Check battery or USB connection. If wireless, try reconnecting the dongle or Bluetooth.

problem: Outlook crashes on opening.
solution: Run Outlook in safe mode (`outlook.exe /safe`). If it works, disable add-ins one by one.

problem: HR portal gives 500 error after login.
solution: Clear browser cache and cookies, then try again. If issue persists, escalate to HR portal dev team.

problem: Teams not syncing messages.
solution: Restart Teams, sign out and sign back in. If still broken, clear Teams cache from `%appdata%`.

problem: Need access to HR shared drive.
solution: Please fill the access request form and get approval from your HR manager.

problem: Requesting access to Jira project XYZ.
solution: Raise an access request via the service portal specifying the project and justification.

problem: I need admin rights to install software.
solution: Submit a software install request. IT will verify the license and grant temporary admin access if valid.

problem: Looking for the company's leave policy.
solution: You can find all HR policies in the internal HR portal under the 'Documents' section.

problem: Need to know how to report phishing emails.
solution: Forward suspected phishing emails to `phishalert@company.com` and notify your manager.
